text: Mehdi Khalis (born 6 January 1989) is a professional football player who currently plays for Olympic Safi . ==Career== Khalis played for Falkirk in the Scottish First Division in the 2010–11 season. During the 2011–12 season, he played 17 league matches for JA Drancy in the Championnat de France amateur.Effectif CFA JA Drancy Saison 2011-2012 On 6 June 2012, he signed for newly promoted Ligue 2 club Chamois Niortais. He made eight appearances in total during the 2012–13 campaign. Khalis was subsequently told in the summer of 2013 that he was not part of manager Pascal Gastien's plans, and in September that year he joined Moroccan club FUS Rabat on a free transfer, signing a three-year contract. Although born in Les Lilas, France, Khalis has represented Morocco internationally at under-21 and under-23 levels. ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1989 births Category:Living people Category:Moroccan footballers Category:Moroccan expatriate footballers Category:People from Les Lilas Category:Association football defenders Category:Falkirk F.C. players Category:JA Drancy players Category:Chamois Niortais F.C. players Category:Fath Union Sport players Category:Muaither SC players Category:Scottish Football League players Category:Ligue 2 players Category:Qatari Second Division players Category:Botola players Category:Championnat National 2 players Category:Sportspeople from Seine- Saint-Denis Category:Moroccan expatriate sportspeople in Scotland Category:Moroccan expatriate sportspeople in Qatar Category:Expatriate footballers in Scotland Category:Expatriate footballers in Qatar
title: Mehdi Khalis
